result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Burt William Peters

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Burt William Peters in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Burt William Peters.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense is not ready to proceed for a plea. Case remains in resolution posture. Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Burt William Peters in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Burt William Peters in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 28.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Burt William Peters in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko, appearing for Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant is advised that Attorney Poznanski is unable to appear in court on today's date as she is in trial on an unrelated case in another court.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Burt William Peters in court by video with Attorney Amanda Poznanski who appears in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Burt William Peters in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/31/22 @ 1:30p
